column2: 2. Before passing a vehicle or changing lanes, remember to:
column4: sound your horn as you pass.
column6: only pass or change lanes if the change can be completed  without speeding.
column8: signal your return to the left lane.

column2: 3. Which statement about taking medications and driving is true?
column4: Prescribed drugs are safe to take at any time.
column6: Cold medications can make a person drowsy.
column8: Over the counter drugs do not affect driving ability.

column2: 4. When passing another car, you have enough room to return to the driving lane when:
column4: you cannot see the vehicle directly to your right.
column6: you can see both headlights of the car you passed in your rearview mirror.
column8: you are at least 50 feet in front of the vehicle.

column2: 5. The amount of alcohol in the blood is measured by:
6. Are drivers allowed to exceed the speed limit to pass other vehicles?
column4: Yes, but only if they drive with caution.
column8: Yes, but only by 10 MPH or less.

column2: 7. What should drivers do when they see this sign?
column4: Make sure the bridge is clear of oncoming traffic before they cross.
column6: Look to the left and right for other traffic.
Do not pass on the left.

column2: 10. If there is no crosswalk and you see a pedestrian crossing your lane, you should:
column4: make sure the pedestrian can see you before proceeding.
column6: honk your horn and proceed with caution.
column8: stop and let the pedestrian finish crossing.

column4: Drive with caution in wet weather.
column6: You must come to a complete stop.
column8: Slow down and give vehicles crossing your path the right-of-way.

column2: 22. When approaching someone using a white cane or guide dog, drivers should:
column4: slow down and be prepared to stop.
column8: come to a complete stop and invite them to take the right-of-way.

column2: 23. If your wheels drop off the pavement edge, you should:
column4: turn gradually back onto the roadway when safe.
column8: turn back onto the roadway immediately.

column2: 24. At intersections with a yield sign, you must:
column4: yield the right-of-way to cross traffic close enough to cause conflict.
column8: yield to the vehicles on your left only.
